body: Can you open that same ZIP file on your Mac if you don't download it through express?
yes

OK. I'm not sure if we have any good answers for you unless you can diagnose the issue or upload the ZIP file somewhere for us and provide a full express example where you use `res.download` to serve it so we can reproduce the issue and diagnose it for you.
We'll also need to know the version of express you are using and the version of node you are running your app on.
Let me try to duplicate the issue on a simple project and I will setup a github project for someone to have a look. I will get you all the other information as well.

I created a test project for you to have a look
https://github.com/hubba/express-download-test

The project is generated using yeoman and uses express and angular

express version - 3.4.8
node version - v0.10.25

All you should have to do is pull the repo down
1) npm install
2) bower install
3) grunt serve
4) open localhost:9000
5) Click on link to download file.

I can reproduce the issue on two machines now.

The problem seems to be related to either setup generated by yeoman because this project barely has any changes from generated code.

When I tried a simpler test where there was no yeoman generated code.
https://github.com/hubba/express-download-test2
It works perfectly.

To me this deduces the problem to the setup generated by yeoman but obviously I can be wrong about that.

any help is greatly appreciated.

Between the working example and the not working example the only difference is the actual content-length in the header

File size on disk - 657Kb

Not working

```
content-length:1226308
```

working

```
Content-Length:657266
```

So any ideas what could cause the content length to be wrong? I suspect its an encoding issue of some sort when reading the file but I am not sure what in the configuration could affect that.

So I cloned the not-working repo, installed all the modules with "npm install" and accessed http://localhost:3000/api/awesomeThings and it responded with `Content-Length: 657266` and a working ZIP file...
Oh, I didn't do the `bower install` or `grunt serve` steps. Perhaps that makes a difference?
Nope, I did those two steps now and still the same successful result for me. I will note I am using node.js 0.10.26. instead of 0.10.25.

> I will note I am using node.js 0.10.26. instead of 0.10.25.

I just swapped to 0.10.25 and it is still successful. I have not been able to reproduce your issue yet.

I am closing this for now since both your repos are working for me on node.js 0.10.25. Let me know if you find the issue or have another way for me to reproduce it to look into whatever it is.

It may be important to note that I am running this on Windows, but that shouldn't have any effect.

didn't help at all I tried both
v0.10.28 and v0.10.25 and it still was wrong size for me

I tried 1 more machine now and everyone has the same issue on a mac at least. trying to fire up a ubuntu box to try now.

Just making sure that this is the repo that is working for you.
https://github.com/hubba/express-download-test
same problem on an ubuntu box.
I don't have access to windows box so I can't try but I don't know what could be different

> Just making sure that this is the repo that is working for you. https://github.com/hubba/express-download-test

Yes, that repo (where I go to the angular web page and click the download button) works 100% for me.

> I don't have access to windows box so I can't try but I don't know what could be different

And I don't have access to a non-Windows box :(

How about this: take that ZIP that you are served (the bad one that won't open) and upload it somewhere so I can check out it's bytes?

Give me about 90mims to get back to my desk

Sent from my iPhone

try this https://www.dropbox.com/s/fkz1kk3z14902cr/bulk-output%20%2828%29.zip

seems like the size is double.
OK. How about you open the file in a text editor? Look at what the contents are. it is clearly not an express issue. Perhaps something the livereload stuff is doing.

I agree doesn't not look like an express issue but I was hoping you guys can shed some light on it.

I can't get any editor to open that not-working file.

Just running node server.js also causes the issue so I don't think it can be liveloader.

> I can't get any editor to open that not-working file.

You just drop the ZIP file into a text editor. Here is the content: https://gist.github.com/dougwilson/7230b4afb4c0928d5e30

> Just running node server.js also causes the issue so I don't think it can be liveloader.

But the live reload stuff is being used as middleware in the config. You said that your other express app doesn't do that. Perhaps try removing things from the broken app one-by-one until it starts working to find the issue?

> I agree doesn't not look like an express issue but I was hoping you guys can shed some light on it.

Unfortunately I have never used pretty much any of the modules you are using and this is a issue tracker, rather than a help center. You may have much better luck getting an answer from somewhere like stackoverflow.com
Is this problem solved now? I also encountered the same problem.
Saw this error today with .zip files. I am not using `connect-livereload` middleware still I see the issue.
@ashubham please create a reproducible example and add it to this issue.  Without that, it’s close to impossible to help you
And seeing as this issue is several years closed, and you seem to indicate it is different (due to lack of that middleware), please open a new issue with the requested information.
